metadata.title: CVE-2013-2919 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 30.0.1599.66, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-chromedriver - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
